00042 int
00043 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00044 {
00045         struct context ctx;
00046         struct tuple *s, *t, *u;
00047         double *A_re, *A_im, *W_re, *W_im;
00048 
00049         if (get_server_portnumber(&ctx)) {
00050                 if (argc < 3) {
00051                         /* help message */
00052                         fprintf(stderr,
00053                                 "Usage: %s <server> <portnumber>\n", argv[0]);
00054                         return 1;
00055                 }
00056                 strcpy(ctx.peername, argv[1]);
00057                 ctx.portnumber = atoi(argv[2]);
00058         }
00059 
00060         s = make_tuple("s?????", "fft");
00061         t = make_tuple("s???ss", "fft done", "", "");
00062 
00063         while (1) {
00064                 int n;
00065                 u = get_tuple(s, &ctx);
00066                 if (u == NULL) {
00067                         perror("get_tuple failed");
00068                         exit(1);
00069                 }
00070                 A_re = (double *) tuple_string_field(u, &n, 4);
00071                 n /= sizeof(double);
00072                 A_im = (double *) tuple_string_field(u, NULL, 5);
00073 
00074                 W_re = (double *) malloc(sizeof(double) * n / 2);
00075                 if (W_re == NULL) {
00076                         fprintf(stderr, "out of memory\n");
00077                         return 1;
00078                 }
00079                 W_im = (double *) malloc(sizeof(double) * n / 2);
00080                 if (W_im == NULL) {
00081                         fprintf(stderr, "out of memory\n");
00082                         return 1;
00083                 }
00084 
00085                 compute_W(n, W_re, W_im);
00086                 fft(n, A_re, A_im, W_re, W_im);
00087                 permute_bitrev(n, A_re, A_im);
00088 
00089                 t->elements[1] = u->elements[1];
00090                 t->elements[2] = u->elements[2];
00091                 t->elements[3] = u->elements[3];
00092 
00093                 t->elements[4].data.s.len = n * sizeof(double);
00094                 t->elements[5].data.s.len = n * sizeof(double);
00095                 t->elements[4].data.s.ptr = (char *) A_re;
00096                 t->elements[5].data.s.ptr = (char *) A_im;
00097 
00098                 if (put_tuple(t, &ctx)) {
00099                         perror("put_tuple failed");
00100                         exit(1);
00101                 }
00102                 free(W_re);
00103                 free(W_im);
00104         }
00105 
00106         return 0;
00107 }

00120 static void
00121 compute_W(int n, double *W_re, double *W_im)
00122 {
00123         int i, br;
00124         int log2n = log_2(n);
00125 
00126         for (i = 0; i < (n / 2); i++) {
00127                 br = bitrev(i, log2n - 1);
00128                 W_re[br] = cos(((double) i * 2.0 * M_PI) / ((double) n));
00129                 W_im[br] = sin(((double) i * 2.0 * M_PI) / ((double) n));
00130         }
00131 }
00132 
00133 
00137 static void
00138 permute_bitrev(int n, double *A_re, double *A_im)
00139 {
00140         int i, bri, log2n;
00141         double t_re, t_im;
00142 
00143         log2n = log_2(n);
00144 
00145         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00146                 bri = bitrev(i, log2n);
00147 
00148                 /* skip already swapped elements */
00149                 if (bri <= i)
00150                         continue;
00151 
00152                 t_re = A_re[i];
00153                 t_im = A_im[i];
00154                 A_re[i] = A_re[bri];
00155                 A_im[i] = A_im[bri];
00156                 A_re[bri] = t_re;
00157                 A_im[bri] = t_im;
00158         }
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00166 static int
00167 bitrev(int inp, int numbits)
00168 {
00169         int i, rev = 0;
00170         for (i = 0; i < numbits; i++) {
00171                 rev = (rev << 1) | (inp & 1);
00172                 inp >>= 1;
00173         }
00174         return rev;
00175 }
00176 
00177 
00181 static int
00182 log_2(int n)
00183 {
00184         int res;
00185         for (res = 0; n >= 2; res++)
00186                 n = n >> 1;
00187         return res;
00188 }
00189 
00200 static void
00201 fft(int n, double *A_re, double *A_im, double *W_re, double *W_im)
00202 {
00203         double w_re, w_im, u_re, u_im, t_re, t_im;
00204         int m, g, b;
00205         int mt, k;
00206 
00207         /* for each stage */
00208         for (m = n; m >= 2; m >>= 1) {
00209                 mt = m >> 1;
00210 
00211                 /* for each group of butterfly */
00212                 for (g = 0, k = 0; g < n; g += m, k++) {
00213                         /* each butterfly group uses only one root of
00214                          * unity. actually, it is the bitrev of this
00215                          * group's number k. BUT 'bitrev' it as a
00216                          * log2n-1 bit number because we are using a
00217                          * lookup array of nth root of unity and using
00218                          * cancellation lemma to scale nth root to
00219                          * n/2, n/4,... th root.
00220                          *
00221                          * It turns out like the foll.
00222                          *   w.re = W[bitrev(k, log2n-1)].re;
00223                          *   w.im = W[bitrev(k, log2n-1)].im;
00224                          *
00225                          * Still, we just use k, because the lookup
00226                          * array itself is bit-reversal permuted.
00227                          */
00228                         w_re = W_re[k];
00229                         w_im = W_im[k];
00230 
00231                         /* for each butterfly */
00232                         for (b = g; b < (g + mt); b++) {
00233                                 t_re = w_re * A_re[b + mt] - w_im * A_im[b +
00234                                                                          mt];
00235                                 t_im = w_re * A_im[b + mt] + w_im * A_re[b +
00236                                                                          mt];
00237 
00238                                 u_re = A_re[b];
00239                                 u_im = A_im[b];
00240                                 A_re[b] = u_re + t_re;
00241                                 A_im[b] = u_im + t_im;
00242                                 A_re[b + mt] = u_re - t_re;
00243                                 A_im[b + mt] = u_im - t_im;
00244 
00245                         }
00246                 }
00247         }
00248 }
